abstracts.cdata!:
In 1998, Turkey embarked on a program of
            poverty reduction on an epic scale. Virtually overnight, it
            extended compulsory primary school education from five years
            to eight. The program cost an average of 3 billion dollars a
            year. The World Bank chipped in with two phases of 300
            million dollars to finance different aspects of the reform
            where it felt its involvement will make a difference.
